comment.author: 39191857@N05
comment._content: Such an unusual shot for a film photograph?  It is quite different in its approach and composition to most and very interesting for that reason.  I was visiting Galway a lot around then but was more interested in rivers and rugby pitches so I can't help with Mullins but the boy reminds me of myself just a few years earlier.

comment.author: 57899800@N00
comment._content: A butchers shop, I think - so the kid is dreaming of mince. A look at Google maps shows that the building is intact but painted a startling lime green  - and home to a creperie called Zatsuma. A creperie in Galway City. Who'd have guessed that in 1964?

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/yellowbookltd] Mince, eh? That's what I get for stereotyping children - thinking of a sweet tooth instead of carnivorous tendencies...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: This is as close as I can get in Streetview.

comment.author: 47290943@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Oh don't talk to me! Spent a good 5 minutes trying to get the same view - slithering up and down Shop Street, muttering ominously that if Mr O'Dea could do it, then so could I. Shamefacedly gave up, but I am bloodied but unbowed.

Virtual sticky bun (hot from the wholly imaginary NLI oven) for anyone who can get the same view in Streetview...
comment.authorname: National Library of Ireland on The Commons

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content:
Shop on the left, D & M, Davey and M**yn, Davey and Martyn, maybe?

Players Please sign at roof level.

comment.author: 30369211@N00
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/yellowbookltd] If I squint just right at the original size image, the sign at the bottom of Mullins window at the boys shoulder says "CHOPS"

comment.author: 77199267@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/gnmcauley] Most likely Martyn, a Galway name (one of the tribes) and the pub around the corner used to be called Trigger Martyn's

comment.author: 14302637@N08
comment._content: Here is the scene in Birds Eye View A butchers shop next to a graveyard? maps.osi.ie/publicviewer/#V1,529741,725210,7,9

comment._content: as a kid i remember it being a butchers but i was born in 76 so i may be wrong

comment._content: Thank you all! Really delighted with the information that you've contributed on this one. It's amazing what we can find out about just one simple street corner in lovely Galway city.
